greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of log(2 + sqrt(3)).
comment: x = 2^n - 1 is prime if and only if x divides cosh(2^(n - 2)*log(2 + sqrt(3))).
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
formula: Equals arccosh(2) since arccosh(x) = log(x + sqrt(x^2 - 1)). - _Stanislav Sykora_, Nov 01 2013
mathematica: First@ RealDigits[Log[2 + Sqrt@ 3], 10, 102] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 12 2019 *)
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 2080); x=log(2 + sqrt(3)); for (n=1, 2000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b065918.txt", n, " ", d)) \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Nov 04 2009
results.author: _Frank Ellermann_, Dec 08 2001
